definition: to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale
to bind/bunch/bundle/classifier for bunches, bundles, beams of light etc/to control

sentences.english: Please note that your counter-offer is binding for seven days.
sentences.chinese: 請注意，您的反要約是有約束力的七天。

sentences.english: When you cohabit , it adds a sense of commitment to a relationship that is going nowhere.
sentences.chinese: 同居讓一段難以有進展的關係又多了一層約束力。

sentences.english: The award made by the Tribunal shall be final and binding upon both parities.
sentences.chinese: 該仲裁庭的裁決是終局的，對雙方均具有約束力。

sentences.english: The arbitral award shall be final and binding upon both parties.
sentences.chinese: 仲裁裁決是終局的，對雙方都有約束力。

sentences.english: In China, a red stamp or "chop" is put on contracts to make them legally binding .
sentences.chinese: 在中國，蓋一個紅色的章能讓合同具有法律的約束力。

sentences.english: This agreement is eligible for the successors or concessionaires of any parties.
sentences.chinese: 本協議對每一方的繼承人和受讓人均有約束力。

sentences.english: The AU says the panel's decisions will be legally binding.
sentences.chinese: 非盟說，這個小組的決定將具有法律約束力。

sentences.english: Next, that agreement has to be codified into binding law or regulations.
sentences.chinese: 下一步是，該協議必須轉變爲有約束力的法律或法規。

sentences.english: His solution is declaring a marriage with a rush-ring legally binding.
sentences.chinese: 他宣佈燈心草戒指意味着這次婚姻具有法律約束力。

sentences.english: The award shall be final and binding upon both parties.
sentences.chinese: 仲裁裁決是終裁的，對雙方均有約束力。

sentences.english: However, details of the non-binding agreement are undisclosed.
sentences.chinese: 然而，這項沒有約束力的協議的細節尚未公開。

sentences.english: The decision made bcdfds. com this Commission shall be regarded as final and binding upon both parties.
sentences.chinese: 該委員會的決定是終，對雙方均約束力。

sentences.english: This Joint Declaration and its Annexes shall be equally binding.
sentences.chinese: 本聯合聲明及其附件具有同等約束力。

sentences.english: Once the contract is approved by the Chinese government， it is legally binding upon both parties.
sentences.chinese: 合同一經中國政府批准，對雙方就有了法律約束力。

sentences.english: The time schedule set down in the order is imperatively binding on the supplier.
sentences.chinese: 定單中所列進度表對供應商具有當然的約束力。

sentences.english: Decisions made by the General Assembly and Economic and Social Council are non-binding.
sentences.chinese: 而聯合國大會和經社委員會的決議不具有約束力。

definition: to conclude (treaty, contract, agreement etc)/to set up (a rule etc)
to counter accusations/to protest/to remonstrate/to retort/to plead/to demur/a plea (of not guilty)/a defense (against an allegation)/to enter a plea to a charge (in a law court)
